Description: Body sherd of Chian Wild Goat Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior: only trace of slip remaining; exterior: from left, part of large maeander square, vertical maeander and vertical dot and billet pattern band; to right, painted decoration consisting of hind legs of goat, to right; rising roundel as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes this sherd as being in the style of the Würzburg chalices as the sherd displays patterns similar to those depicted on the Würzburg chalices (Lemos 1991, 72).
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1886 / Naukratis. Part I., 1884-85 (pl. V, no. 27)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 72 and p. 234, no. 132, pl. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0167) (phase 2)
